region.title: First Impressions
region.observation: Notice how this painting feels energetic and alive, with bold colors swirling around like a storm or celebration
region.why_notable: First feelings often reveal what the artist wanted us to experience
region.soft_prompt: What does this painting make you feel? Does it remind you of anything in your life?

steps.why_this_sequence: Starting with emotional connection helps Stage 1 viewers engage personally

region.title: The Mysterious Face
region.observation: See how there's a face-like shape in the center, with dark areas that could be eyes and a nose
region.why_notable: Our brains love finding faces - it makes abstract art feel more human
region.soft_prompt: What kind of expression do you see? Happy, sad, mysterious, or something else?

steps.why_this_sequence: After emotions, focus on recognizable shapes they can connect to
steps.builds_on: The energetic feeling now has a focal point - like finding a person in a crowd

region.title: A Sky Full of Stories
region.observation: Notice the beautiful blue and green colors at the top, like looking up at a cloudy sky on a bright day
region.why_notable: These soft colors create a dreamy backdrop that makes the face feel peaceful
region.soft_prompt: Does this remind you of looking at clouds and seeing shapes in them?

steps.why_this_sequence: Building on the face discovery by exploring the surrounding environment
steps.builds_on: The face isn't alone - it exists in this dreamy, sky-like world

region.title: The Artist's Energy
region.observation: See all the different brushstrokes and marks - some smooth, some scratchy, some bold black lines
region.why_notable: Each mark shows how the artist was feeling as they painted, like handwriting shows personality
region.soft_prompt: Imagine the artist painting this - were they moving fast or slow? Excited or calm?

steps.why_this_sequence: Ending with the human connection to the artist's process
steps.builds_on: All these marks and colors came from a real person expressing their feelings

welcome_text: Let's explore this colorful painting together! We'll take our time and discover what stories and feelings are hiding in these bold brushstrokes.

final_summary.main_takeaway: This painting is like a window into someone's emotions - full of energy, mystery, and the joy of creating something from nothing
final_summary.connections: The dreamy sky colors, the mysterious face, and all those expressive brushstrokes work together to create something that feels both human and magical
final_summary.invitation_to_return: Next time you see this, you might discover completely new faces or feelings hiding in those colorful layers!
final_summary.reflection_question: What would your painting look like if you painted how you're feeling right now?

pedagogical_approach: Emotional connection first, then concrete observations, building to personal meaning-making through storytelling and imagination

reflection_activities.title: Feelings in Color
reflection_activities.prompt: You noticed this painting feels like emotions and energy. What colors do you see that make you feel something? Pick one color and tell me what feeling it gives you.
reflection_activities.placeholder: The blue makes me feel calm like the ocean...
reflection_activities.why_this_activity: Assesses ability to connect visual elements to personal emotional responses, building observational confidence

reflection_activities.title: Your Emotion Painting
reflection_activities.prompt: You asked what your painting would look like if you painted your feelings right now. Describe or sketch what that painting would look like - what colors, shapes, or marks would you use?
reflection_activities.placeholder: Swirly purple lines for excitement, dots for...
reflection_activities.why_this_activity: Evaluates ability to translate personal experience into visual thinking and creative expression

reflection_activities.title: The Mystery Face
reflection_activities.prompt: You discovered a mysterious face in this painting. Look at it again - what do you think that face might be thinking or feeling? What makes you think that?
reflection_activities.why_this_activity: Tests ability to interpret visual cues and provide reasoning, moving toward evidence-based thinking

assessment.feedback: You're doing well at your current level. Keep practicing and challenging yourself with new observations.
